website_summaries.verdict: A brawny yet adjustable grip helps you execute impressive bar lifts with less fatigue.
pros: Dynamic hook positioning is a standout feature here, as it allows you to adjust based on your hand and wrist size
Hooks are wide enough to fit most bars
Neoprene cuffs add a comfort factor to the straps, and the rubberized hook coating grips bars tightly
cons: Best suited for people with large hands

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality for powerlifting
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these over a year ago and they lasted for about 8 months. Then the hooks bent and I had to order new ones. I used the new set for three sets of shrugs and the seam tore out of them, causing me to have them replaced. When the new set arrived, the same thing happened the first time I used them. In place of returning them, I removed the bent hooks from my old pair and replaced them with the hooks from this new pair. I used them today with more weight then I was lifting with the original new pairs, and I had no issues. I am disappointed in the quality of the stitching...
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: I can row with heavy weights again!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to take some of the strain off of my grip when weightlifting (I have some tendon damage in my hands). They work beautifully for that purpose when doing heavy rows and other 'pulling' movements, and flop out of the way when doing 'push' movements like presses, so you can leave them on for the whole workout. A particular benefit that these have over most other weightlifting hooks is that you can adjust the reach by moving the hook from one side of the attaching strap to the other. The two positions make for a much better chance of getting them to fit you hands.
customer_reviews.author: John Bendiksen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: These helped me get to the next level on some lifts. Grip strength is important but it can hold me back especially at the end of a workout. These are great to keep an exercise going after I've exhausted my hands. Straps are adequate but the take longer to put on, and cannot help so much with some exercises.
customer_reviews.author: likes2sing

customer_reviews.title: Will help you pick up heavy stuff, but not comfortably.
customer_reviews.text: To help save my back I moved my heaviest deadlifts to a trap bar, but that made using my double loop lifting straps difficult to use . These work well, though I have giant hands , and the hooks don’t line up with my fingers. It’s not too bad for relatively short duration 1-5 reps heavy deadlift, but begins to get uncomfortable when I use them for farmers walks after my grip gives out after 4-5 sets. Also it doesn’t always want to hold the first time I put them on , requiring a 2nd go cinching them down. I realized this by tugging on them, and have not had them fail mid lift.
customer_reviews.author: J in CA

customer_reviews.title: Recommended or gym enthusiasts!
customer_reviews.text: I used to wear lifting straps but I decided to give this ones a try. I have read some reviews that say theirs gave up or didn't last. However, this have worked great for me and I've now used them for over a year. Granted, the rubber covering peels off pretty fast, but I consider that to be normal wear and tear. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: These have saved me!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are a necessity for anybody wishing to lift heavier weights, but doesn't have the forearm strength. I'm not interested in building my forearms. I'm a female who is looking to build leg strength through squats, lunges, etc. Many of exercises use heavy dumbbells. I can use heavier dumbbells and workout longer with the use of these hooks. I also use the hooks with the barbell while doing deadlifts, etc. These hooks have really enabled me to lift heavier than if I did not have them. I would recommend them to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Spends way too much

customer_reviews.title: fit perfect around bars and even ones with cushion grips
customer_reviews.text: fit perfect around bars and even ones with cushion grips. Holds to my wrist great. I bought these because of bone spurs in my hands have prevented me from doing low rows, dead lifts, rows, shrugs etc I never do back/shoulder workouts without them now. Lets me go heavy again. LOVE'M. The way the straps hold there is very little slippage and you can get them TIGHT ....even to the point your hands turn purple!! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Warner Radio

customer_reviews.title: Good quality material, but very uncomfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the product is good, however, as someone that has always used traditional straps in the past I have to say these are incredibly uncomfortable. I will probably only use them in a pinch or when my straps aren't available. I may try them out on lat pull-down machines. I got them for barbell shrugs and deadlifts. It is impossible to position the hooks in a way that they aren't digging into your hands while you're squeezing the bar. At heavier weights this is very uncomfortable. I definitely prefer straps.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C

customer_reviews.title: because they make gym equipment that you will more than get your money back for and can hold up to some pretty rugged abuse
customer_reviews.text: The biggest issue with bodybuilding is hitting muscle failure in support muscles (ie: forearms) before major muscle groups have reached fatigue. These are a must have for anyone that needs that last 15 rep set for lats and traps. Never have complained with Harbinger...why?? because they make gym equipment that you will more than get your money back for and can hold up to some pretty rugged abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the only reason i had to get more is that the blue coating rips off fairly quickly and the lateral grip from that is extremely useful. Other then that the hooks refuse to bend ...
customer_reviews.text: For disabilities this product is a God- send. I am on my second pair, the only reason i had to get more is that the blue coating rips off fairly quickly and the lateral grip from that is extremely useful. Other then that the hooks refuse to bend and the padding and stitching has never ripped, and I put up some serious weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Really like these. I really prefer these over straps. I only use them on deadlifts, and I hate taking a long time to set up before pulling. Wrapping the straps around the bar is ok, but these make it much easier for me to get in place, find my grip, and pull. Have had them a few months, and I deadlift twice a week. So far, the hooks seem to be perfectly in tact. Also doesnt' feel too bad or painful around your wrist when strapping them on really tightly.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: No..don’t...SKIP these!
customer_reviews.text: Awkward...a little useless. Reps went down because it is so awkward and puts strain in places they shouldn’t be putting strain.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Super strong and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These hooks are a lifesaver for me. I absolutely love them! They're comfortable, sturdy and super strong and fit almost every type of bar I use at the gym. They even fit on standard dumbells as well as the pull-up bar. I can put these on and take them off very quickly and their velcro is very strong. These are made with very heavy-duty materials and I anticipate their lasting me quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Wagner Family

customer_reviews.title: Work great for me
customer_reviews.text: Very nice!Easy to get on and off.Easy to hook onto bar/barbell/dumbbell.Takes the strain off forearms/grip when doing pullups/pulldowns,rowing,etc
customer_reviews.author: tiny tim

customer_reviews.title: Purchased many times prior but recent purchased failed on first use.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for at least 6 years and have never had a problem with it. I have purchased it at least 3 times before, replacing them when the rubber wears out. My most recent purchase had the stitching tear on first use for a 70 pound dumbbell. The sticking has never come loose prior and were surprisingly dependable. I hope this is a QC issue and the general manufacturing process has not changed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifting Hooks Increase Workout Performance
customer_reviews.text: Since I saw these being used online by a female fitness advocate, it made sense to not stress out other muscles while working others. I am getting 50% more out of my workouts using these on barbells, dumbbells, and other machines. It has made my lifts much safer with the added grip of the hooks. I wish I had them years ago, but I have them now.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Stick to straps!
customer_reviews.text: Construction is okay, but lifting with these is very awkward. I tried it once and hated the feeling. Stick with straps where your grip can supplement the work that the straps provide. With these hooks, your wrists bear the full load with not weight handled by your palms.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems to have changed.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if I got one with defective stitching or if they changed how they stitch these together, but after a month and a half the hooks completely ripped out. I had a previous pair of these for 4 years that worked great, but the Velcro started wearing out so I got these to replace them. They only lasted 6 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Shaylyn

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Hooks hand too low and are not adjustable. Bad design. Made in china = crap.
customer_reviews.author: J P

customer_reviews.title: with these on it takes the pressure off my hands so I can workout my arms longer and better. No more "dealth gripping the weight
customer_reviews.text: Must have if u have sensitive hands ! I wasn't able to finish some of my workouts because my hands would give out before I was done, with these on it takes the pressure off my hands so I can workout my arms longer and better . No more "dealth gripping the weights " as my trainer would call it
customer_reviews.author: marla

customer_reviews.title: I'm hooked!
customer_reviews.text: Great for when you want to deadlift but your hands say no. I don't recommend using these to hang from bars that are taller than you. Especially in the gym. You will look like an idiot trying to unhook yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfort is good but craftsmanship is poor.
customer_reviews.text: The stitching tore off the first time we used over 315lbs on a shrug.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Durand

customer_reviews.title: very poor quality. Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The rubber coating came off the hooks the first time I used them. The metal ring the straps go through to tighten up are right where your wrist bone is making it very uncomfortable to use. The stitching on the velcro came loose on one strap the second time using them. They look good out of the package but are very poor quality. I would never buy these again
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Guitard

customer_reviews.title: Just 2 things I don't like: If it comes with the smaller (narrower) hooks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this soon after my wrist surgery. It works well for the weights, dumbbells and most of the machines. Just 2 things I don't like : If it comes with the smaller (narrower) hooks, that would be perfect. You can adjust the length but it's still too wide for the most of the women. Also, once you put the hook is in the shorter side, it's hard to remove. The wrist band part has the pad like thing which is again too big for the women.
customer_reviews.author: Michie Reigle

customer_reviews.title: The hooks are good and everything
customer_reviews.text: The hooks are good and everything, but the rubber wore off very quickly. The product otherwise works good, i just don't recommend doing too heavy, use regular straps for that. I like them for medium weight range, or low weight high reps.
customer_reviews.author: freddog2325

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: complete garbage. Broke first time using while doing shrugs. Replacement was quickly sent, now replacement just broke as well. Do NOT waste your money on this cheap product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the straps with the fabric wraps for the bars ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the straps with the fabric wraps for the bars better. The metal on these always catch on my shorts and equipment. Novel approach but I used them a few times for dead lifts and went back to my old school pure fabric wraps. It might be a preference thing, don't hesitate to ask to try em if you see someone using them, you might love them. Quality build, just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done
customer_reviews.text: Consistently perform with over 300 pounds on the bar. Great for those of us with tendonitis.
customer_reviews.author: Northern Traveler

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: bought these for my boyfriend and he loves them. great products and I've heard zero complaints about his wrist injuries.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have owned several lifting hooks previously. These are by far the best. Pros: - LARGE hooks will fit around even larger dumbell handles - Great padding and support - very comfortable compared with other brands. Extra padding and support around the wrist. - Relatively inexpensive - cost me $23/pair. Many places sell that price for one. Cons: - Haven't found any yet.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy H. Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Without them my hands turn completely white and hurt really bad..
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh these help my grip so much on the dead lift. It's either wear these and be able to lift a lot of weight, or don't wear them and don't do deadlifts, which I was not willing to do. Without them my hands turn completely white and hurt really bad...I've got some medical issues that I think are the cause of this but who cares - these things rock!
customer_reviews.author: Delinda Sowder

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: I got these to do some heavy farmer carry with big hex bells. Work well but dig hard into your wrist after a bit. They work pretty good but they're really isn't a perfect lift strap or aid yet made. I would say to get them but also have a standard pair of wraps too. Takes a little getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wallis

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Used them today for shrugs with no problem. Did not hurt my hands. Did not hurt my wrist with the extra weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: These Eliminate the Need for Lifting Straps!
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered these through my account and loves them so much he threw away his straps which these hooks were replacing. Before he ordered them and after he used them he kept asking, "Why had no one thought of these before?!?!?"
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve Meyer

customer_reviews.title: The lifting hooks were a gift. I believe he ...
customer_reviews.text: The lifting hooks were a gift. I believe he likes them or I most likely would have heard otherwise. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: ... fan of these as they cut into my wrists pretty good. However
customer_reviews.text: Not a big fan of these as they cut into my wrists pretty good. However, full disclosure, I did purchase these because my grip had been weakened due to a dislocated finger. Not sure if they would be better once the finger is healed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Yoo

customer_reviews.title: Save your grip
customer_reviews.text: The plastic covering tore easy but the chrome under it is holding up great and I've pulled 500lbs with them and use them nearly every day
customer_reviews.author: Amy Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Buy the plastic ones that form to your hands
customer_reviews.text: I really like these hooks. They are very sturdy and definitely help my deadlifting. It is just kind of awkward to hold around the hooks, and you have to be careful to not let them pinch your skin. I would rather buy the plastic ones that form better to your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love these hooks! They're great when doing leg exercises with heavy dumbbells. Really helps take the strain off of my arms. They take a minute to get used to but other than that, perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy straps
customer_reviews.text: Second purchase on these - I like them vs straps. Very sturdy and hooks work around most bars.
customer_reviews.author: Housekey

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Very good, works as suppose to. Only thing I turned hooks inwards as its was causing pain hooks facing out
customer_reviews.author: Maurice R

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and works as intended, but the hooks are not adjustable vertically with the strap shown. There is some space in the loop with the hook so you can slightly adjust the hook into the right place inside your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Kovacik

customer_reviews.title: Better than straps for some movements
customer_reviews.text: These hooks work well for shrugs and the two length loop feature provides some accommodation for hand size differences. Drawback is the padding doesn't cover the strap completely and is breaking down quickly, resulting in wrist abrasions.
customer_reviews.author: John Kuster

customer_reviews.title: Great fix and feel
customer_reviews.text: I love using these for deadlifts and pretty much all of my back routes great fit and feel
customer_reviews.author: T.M.

customer_reviews.title: great product for heavy lifting
customer_reviews.text: I have always used the normal straps to support my forearms when I lift heavy weights. I had to try these hooks because of my tennis elbow problems: they works fine and they download the weight on my wrists. Great manufacture and quality
customer_reviews.author: Luchino_1980

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful.
customer_reviews.text: Helps greatly for this elder in handling more weight. Hands no longer are as sore after intense work outs. Now 120# back rows are not so challenging. I choose not to use with dumbbells under 90# to keep grip strength up.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I wouldnt recommend these for deadlifts but there awesome back day grips so practical
customer_reviews.author: The Good Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: The hooks work ok for most exercises. Chin pulls or anything with a close grip, they tend to come off the bar. I've used a different brand's solid hook and didn't have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son who is a quadriplegic (unable to grip). He can attach to wrist and hang bar bells for exercise. We reversed the hooks to meet his needs. Easy in changing weights as well. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: G Silver

customer_reviews.title: These things actually work.
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for quick release hooks to help alleviate a forearm tightness I'm working through. I use these on pull ups and deadlifts.
customer_reviews.author: jac

customer_reviews.title: Great hooks . Good value
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these hooks . Very comfortable . At first I was a little apprehensive about how comfortable this would be, however your hand just goes over hooks and they are very comfortable. These are great if you have problems with carpal tunnel.
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found these before buying more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.text: Looked everywhere for some affordable but sturdy hooks. Did not think i would find any and almost brought some expensive ones. Glad i didn't! these are perfect. Very durable and solid and comfortable on the wrist
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: Great product, the rubber will rub off the hooks
customer_reviews.text: Great product, the rubber will rub off the hooks, but it does not effect the function. Had them for over a year still working great. Ive done 500 pound rows with them, no problem
customer_reviews.author: kloned1

customer_reviews.title: Strong and secure
customer_reviews.text: Hooks are a little bigger than I expected, but fit deadlift bar nicely. Wrist strap and suspension seem very strong and durable. Immediately added 20 pounds to my deadlift, just with the secure grip.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure they are good for some people
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure they are good for some people, but for me.., the hooks got in the way of and hand grip I'm might of needed..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST LIFTING HOOKS
customer_reviews.text: Best lifting hooks I've used. I had little to no grip in my left hand and using these helped me move up in weight. A little upset because I lost one of them but I only need it for my left hand anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Sukh Singh

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for doing pull ups, and shrugs....basically anything that requires pulling. Fast shipping. Seem very durable
customer_reviews.author: average guy

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Broke after my 2nd set... if I wasn't also holding the bar and had been only using the straps I might have ruined my back
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Vilela

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these lifting hooks
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these lifting hooks! With tendinitis in my wrist, I needed something to support my wrist so I could lift heavier. These work great!
customer_reviews.author: kristen

customer_reviews.title: Ripped on use
customer_reviews.text: These ripped right off when engaged, I have had others in the past that are rock solid I am not 100% sure but it seems they may have changed something in the building process ?
customer_reviews.author: john caillet

customer_reviews.title: Expecting better gains will these added to my gym bag
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have invested in a pair of these a long time ago. I noticed a big difference. Definitely able to continue with heavy lifts after my hands and wrist can take much more. Expecting better gains will these added to my gym bag.
customer_reviews.author: NChat

customer_reviews.title: Just what he needed
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband so he could lift heavier weights and not agrivate a previous injury. They are working great and he is lifting more than ever!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: Like a few others, I decided to reverse the direction of the hooks. For me, they are much more manageable.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am not comfortable using the item itself. But the transaction is great.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio Zamora

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but the rubber coating on the hooks will wear off during the first heavy workout exposing the metal hooks underneath. Also, the velcro does not last as long as expected. Still the best on the market but won't last longer than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Jordan

customer_reviews.title: been using them for a year
customer_reviews.text: after about 9 months of heavy use, the stitching broke on one of them and I threw it away. Also, the plastic covering wore off quickly after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mock

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product. Enhances every workout you use them for. Allows you to focus more on the targeted muscles rather than gripping. No calluses either.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Quag

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: As always, Harbinger comes through with flying colors. I wish these had been available years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Pocatellocowboy

customer_reviews.title: ... companies hooks which did work okay but these are awesome. They came set up for the smaller hand ...
customer_reviews.text: I had another companies hooks which did work okay but these are awesome. They came set up for the smaller hand length and the fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen T. Lalley

customer_reviews.title: Broke while daughter was deadlifting
customer_reviews.text: 275lbs. Broke. All of that weight came crashing down toward her shin. She just did get out of the way. The stitching around the metal hooks gave way. Very angry.
customer_reviews.author: Charles B.

customer_reviews.title: Love these! I use these every time I do ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I use these every time I do deadlifts and back workouts. They take a lot Of stress of my forearms and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These hooks work great. i can take all the strain from my ...
customer_reviews.text: I have some slight arthritis in 3 of my fingers which makes ut difficult to lift any heavier weights. These hooks work great.i can take all the strain from my fingersand just focus on technique
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Great for hanging to relieve hands and prevent calluses.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for stretching. I only use these so I can hang from a chinup bar longer. Going without these leaves calluses on my hands and I can't do it as long. I can't comment on doing any lifting with these.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Junk clips too long for wrist strap. Made for someone with huge hands only
customer_reviews.author: moehacket

customer_reviews.title: These are useful for only certain exercises
customer_reviews.text: These are useful for only certain exercises. I find that sometimes I have to be extra careful when lifting because the edge of the hook will sometimes pinch my finger.
customer_reviews.author: Corryn Welsh

customer_reviews.title: They feel pretty high quality in general
customer_reviews.text: The wraps around the wrists have a lot of cushion. When I dead lift 250lbs, I don't have any discomfort at all. They feel pretty high quality in general.
customer_reviews.author: nobody_but_you

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE JUST PLAIN DOPE!! HELP WITH MAXIMIZING THE GAINS!!!
customer_reviews.author: SamMtz

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I used a previous pair for five years before I wore them out. They are well built.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: I love these hooks
customer_reviews.text: I love these hooks. I use them for farmers walks. I can't imagine I'd ever look for another pair. I am a male with narrow wrists, and they can be tightened easily around my wrists. The coating on hooks keeps them from slipping on the bar. What more could I want?
customer_reviews.author: Style Is Love

customer_reviews.title: These things are great. I use them to hang from a pull ...
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. I use them to hang from a pull up bar for several minutes to release all the tension in my back
customer_reviews.author: Michael Addison Melton

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Getting used to the grip is odd but I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Becca B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Solid and very helpful. hard to beat the price/quality you get
customer_reviews.author: Team Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband to use for his workouts and he loves them. They work exactly as they should and do their job well.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: These hook really allow you to focus more on strength and form rather than grip. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get!
customer_reviews.text: This product broke the 1st time my son used it. Strap literally broke right off!
customer_reviews.author: P. M.

customer_reviews.title: Good lifting hooks.
customer_reviews.text: Very good lifting hooks. I especially like that the hook can be turned around for reverse grip. Without these I couldn't lift at all since I am a quadraplegic.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product, good design, the only thing is that the blue cover peeled so easy, need to reinforce please
customer_reviews.author: Juan Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Love these! Great to put these puppies on after ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Great to put these puppies on after my grip strength has given out, to get those extra reps in for pulling movements and shrugs.
customer_reviews.author: Chris O.

customer_reviews.title: Great for pulling exercises.
customer_reviews.text: Great to help go heavy on back day without losing your grip.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Blue coating came off in the first couple days. Does what its supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Love this things
customer_reviews.text: Great but damn Im afraid they might wear out fast
customer_reviews.author: Pawel G.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as well with smaller hands
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend these to women, unless you have larger hands. The hooks are wide than my pointer finger and pinky, which makes it a bit annoying to lift with. My friend has the hooks that are narrower, and those work way better for me. I still like these, it's as advertised, and I received what I expected. The wrist band is really comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: The stitches gave a way after just 1 month of use Very poor quality
customer_reviews.author: Shafiq

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Just need to get used to wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cannella

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great help! Use each time I row or lift in the gym .
customer_reviews.author: Marina Kuznetsov

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Definitely work as needed. Durable so far and have had friends order them
customer_reviews.author: Gritt

customer_reviews.title: So in love with these
customer_reviews.text: So in love with these! They ensure the right muscles get worked when I lift and I can deadlift way heavier with them and keep my form
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful... Well constructed heavy duty material. I use them for shoulder shrugs and can now easily handle more reps, and weight.
customer_reviews.author: PGH User

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: For these they were too big for my hand and I had returned them
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Bailey

customer_reviews.title: I have arthritis and do not have a very good grip so my training was at a standstill
customer_reviews.text: These have changed my life! I have arthritis and do not have a very good grip so my training was at a standstill. Now I'm progressing so much because of these lifting hooks. I love them!! Thank you Harbinger!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Harbinger Lifting Hooks
product_meta.description: The heaviest lifts require the strongest of training tools, like Harbinger's new Lifting Hooks. With no drop grip, these extra-wide heavy duty hooks will hold the weight when your hand grip fails. Our premium hook coating increases grab on the bar, while the neoprene cuff cushions wrist. Since not all hands are shaped alike, the Harbinger Lifting Hooks feature an exclusive adjustable hook positioning system based on hand size and fully-adjustable nonrestrictive closure.
feature_bullets: No drop grip heavy duty hooks hold weights when hand grip fails
Adjustable hook positioning based on hand size
Extra wide hook works on most bars
Premium hook coating increases grab on bar
